p:
We used the Software for Assisted Habitat Modeling to map the current suitable habitat for caterpillar fungus ( 63). For presence points, we used a unique dataset assembled from locations reported in the literature and supplemented by GPS locations collected during field work in June 2017 ( n = 400) (
SI Appendix, Fig. S1 A ) (data available at https://purl.stanford.edu/ww909xk7776). Environmental predictor variables included elevation, MODIS Vegetation Continuous Fields, and CHELSA (Climatologies at High Resolution for the Earth’s Land Surface Areas) bioclimatic variables (
SI Appendix, Figs. S4 and S5 and Table S5 ). We used the point data and environmental variables to develop predictions from four species distribution models. We used areas where all four models’ habitat predictions overlapped as a conservative input for further analysis.
